channel.title: What was the first game you've ever played.
channel.description:
As the title said, when and how did you lose your metaphorical cherry?
For me it was either Super Mario Bros. 3 on the NES at my niece's house or Super Mario World on the SNES at a friends' house.

item.title: What was the first game you've ever played.
item.dc:creator: Brother_Shrike
item.description:
Umm… PuttPutt travels through time? Maybe. I don’t know. probably some educational game. I just remember puttputt (it was a windows game I think) crashing my mom’s old PPC mac that she got from her boss.

EDIT: actually it might have been Oregon Trail at my friend’s house in preschool. I really don’t know.

item.title: What was the first game you've ever played.
item.dc:creator: Mont_Blanc
item.description:
DinoThrasher:

Personally, I think the N64 is still the best console that was ever made.

Totally

My 1st videogame ever…
Oh yeah, Asteroids on Atari 7800 (1987)

After strait to N64 with Mario Kart and then ending PC with Tiberium Sun.

Ahh, good’ ol days…

item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
flugelhorny:

Windows Pinball. Which is still the best pinball game ever.

EDIT: It’s actually called 3D Pinball SPACE CADET.

I’ve played at least 5 PC pinball games(2 were on DOS) before playing space cadet on windows NT 4.0.

item.source: What was the first game you've ever played.

item.title: What was the first game you've ever played.
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
The_KillSmith:

The one that really got me into PC gaming was Quake though. I mean, DooM did as well (and Heretic and Hexen and such), but technically Quake was what took me over the edge. I’ve never come back…

The game that kind of got me into FPSes was Wolfenstein 3D. I couldn’t stop playing that. I didn’t play much in the way of other FPSes until Quake came out, which I sat down and beat with the only breaks for the bathroom. Then Quake 2. Quake 3 kinda sucked for me because I didn’t like the multiplayer aspect (I’m a single-player kind of guy). Then I heard about this “sciency” game called “Half Life” that had aliens, so I got that. :jizz:

And the rest, as they say, is history.

Read full topic
item.source: What was the first game you've ever played.

item.title: What was the first game you've ever played.
item.dc:creator: The_KillSmith
item.description:
Wow, looking at a bunch of these posts there are quite a few young 'uns here

Hmmm, probably Pitfall for Atari. For PC… well, the ones I remember are Duke Nukem (the platformer, not 3D) and Commander Keen and such. But I probably played some non-memorable ones before that.

The one that really got me into PC gaming was Quake though. I mean, DooM did as well (and Heretic and Hexen and such), but technically Quake was what took me over the edge. I’ve never come back…

Read full topic

item.title: What was the first game you've ever played.
item.dc:creator: _Gotta
item.description:
Spyro the Dragon! Good ol’ Playstation. It got crap after Insominiac sold it off to EA or something. Sometimes I wish that they would remake it for the PS3 in shiny shiny graphics. Got round to re-playing it though on the PSP (custom firmware ftw).
